text:
Mycket mer maltig än jag räknat med, karamelltoner och viss alkoholsmak. Viss sötma, blommig, helt ok.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is caramel, bready malts and spices. The flavor is fruit/citrus, bread, slightly grainy malts and a mix of tart, warming alcohol and spicy hops in the finish.
Backlog. Orange with a small head. Aroma is floral and somewhat grainy. Slightly sweet mouthfeel. Nice bitterness. Good,

Cloudy amber color, small white head. Aroma of alcohol, looots of peach, hops, hints of sugar. Wonderful peachy taste with some pine notes. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very good. //bottle at Craft Room

Ambar escura, turbidez media, espuma alaranjada de boa formação e média persistência. Malte e lúpulo disputando a liderança da intensidade, balanceada, leve gramínea. Paladar inicial de dulçor um pouco mais intenso que o amargor, malte continua evidente, álcool da as caras. Corpo e carbonatação médios na intensidade. Final evidencia o lúpulo, amargor de média persistência, caramelado. A palavra que resume essa cerveja é equilíbrio. Muito boa.

375ml bottle, bbe 14/08/16. Great redish amber pour with a cream coloured head. Aroma with lots of dried pineapples, tropic fruits, toasted malts and an almost honey-like caramel sweetness. Taste of caramel candied dried pineapples balanced by a nice, long lasting fruity bitterness.
Wow, pretty intense aroma and taste with nothing of the 8,5% alcohol showing through. Very well done!
Pouco conhecida e muito pouco comprada no Brasil. A embalagem intimida os novatos. Deve ser usada como referência para o estilo. Sempre tem 3 ou 4 na minha geladeira.

Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się ładna, żółta piana, dość trwała i z niezłym lajsingiem. Barwa bursztynowa, opalizująca. Aromat dość słodki, zdominowany przez dojrzałe owoce tropikalne, jasne winogrona, rodzynki i zioła. W smaku półwytrawne, zdominowane przez chmiel, od razu czuć wyraźną, ziołowo żywiczną goryczkę, są też owoce kandyzowane, marakuja, świerk, trochę nut likierowych, delikatnie rozgrzewający alkohol. Wysycenie niskie, lekko cierpkie, półpełne w odbiorze.
"Kto powiedział, że lager jest martwy?" W tym przypadku te słowa mają uzasadnienie - fajnie nachmielony, mocny lager, który w szybkim tempie znika ze szkła. Tylko ta cena...

Ps.

Warka do 14/08/16.

Butelka 0,375l Kolor brązowy, mętny, piana mocna. Aromat chmielowy z cytrusami i ziołami. Smak zdecydowany ziołowy raczej wytrawny. Nie jestem zwolennikiem strong i imperial lager ale to piwo jest bardzo dobre.

[One of my to-drink beers, especially among those by To Øl, glad I tried it at last] Pours reddish amber with a frothy off-white head. Hoppy aromas come through, floral and very nice. Again, hops and malt very prominent in the flavour profile, wood flavours noticeable throughout, citrus: grapefruit. Great on palate, like an IPA! Oily, long finish, hoppy and very developing. Very good but no regular lager.
375ml green bottle. Lucked out and got this in a 10.99 mix 6er. Oxidized aroma, not skunked though. Flavor is caramel, citrus, oxidized. Joke.

Lagery i pilsnery nie naleza do moich ulubionych. A wersje Strong zle mi się kojaza i wnet ich nie cierpie i nienawidzę. Ale w tym przypadku jeśli Imperialny Pilsner ma tak smakować to jestem za. Wydawalo mi się niemozliwoscia aby tyle smaku można wydobyc z dolnej fermentacji w dodatku w stylach powiedzmy mało szanowanych. Wyglad mocno metny ciemny bursztyn. Zapach powala z nog smażonymi kasztanami, Chmielami egzotycznymi, czyli z US, runem leśnym. Piana wielka stabilna po prostu nawet odrobine nie chce się zmniejszyć. Jest tez pewna slodowosc, ale taka wspolgrajaca z potezna gorycza i wytrawnoscia. Na koniec super opakowanie, papierowa owijka i nawet jeszcze jest etykieta. Plus za to ze się chciało to zrobić. Prawie genialny Imperialny pilsner

Bue en bouteille de 37,5cl. Magnifique couleur ambrée rosée. Mousse blanche persistante. Nez boisé, alcool, fruits noirs. Palais costaud, corpulent, équilibré. Bel assemblage de houblons, notes agrumes, fruits tropicaux et fleurs. Tabasse !

Ambrata carica con riflessi dorati, opalescente, schiuma ocra di ottima persistenza.
Aroma fantastico: biscottata e floreale, resinosa ma non quanto una IPA, albicocche secche, ananas, succo darancia, toffee, cannella, leggero caco, mango, note di pino, leggero erbaceo.
Al palato sempre biscottata e resinosa, ananas, cannella e toffee, coda di albicocca disidrata e caco che successivamente vira su note citriche ed agrumate di pompelmo accompagnate da un erbaceo deciso ma coerente con la bevuta.
Corpo medio, carbonazione tra il medio ed il medio-basso, un po astringente.
Centennial?
KØLF 161015. Pale amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is hop, malt, citrus, oxidation, sugar, hop. Flavour is hop, malt, citrus, oxidation, sugar, hop, floral, herbs, caramel. OK beer.
Pretty good beer. Has a huge, long lasting, frothy head. Aroma is toffee, malt, hops. Flavors hops, resin, toffee, bittersweet, slight tang, oak. Soft palate. Some medicinal finish. Drinkable.

Weird one this... its a bit like posh special brew. Sweet malty base, with an assertive hoppy bitterness. Pretty tasty stuff though. Nice and warming, but I cant help feeling I should be drinking it on a park bench.

Pours a honey color with a small but thick head. Aroma of citrus and maybe a little malt for good measure, not overpowering though. Taste is bitter and malty seems highly carbonated. Overall a pretty good beer and worth the try.
A great combination of the malty-hoppy goodness of a dipa or iipa with the sessionability of a lager. So sad that I only had bought one (portalebirra). It really hit the spot!
Bottle. Citrus, tropical fruits, caramel, pine and spices. Moderately bitter and sweet. Warming (alcohol) and a quite dry and bitter finish.
Mørk gyldenbrun. Veldig høyt tett skum. Utmerket fruktig aroma. Plommer. Kniplingsskum. Topp utseende! Myk munnfølelse. Smaken sammensatt fruktig. Plommer. Fersken. Tørr syrlig ettersmak.
A fruity/citrusy/moderate-high bitter imperial lager. Its pretty good, not amazing, likely better fresher.

375ml dark green bottle wrapped in brown paper. Trade with Skinnyviking. Shared with Finn. Decent off-white head leaving solid artwork on the glassware. Close to clear amber body. Smell of fresh and dusty hops. Fresh citrus taste, including red orange and pine, together with moments of brown malts. Citrus peels to the ending. Full bodied. Smooth. Well-made. Lovely (Tromsø 14.10.2015).

Bottle. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, oxidized notes, some floral notes and herbs. FLavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, chocolate, bitterness and herbs. Medium body, average carbonation.
Very nice beer. Sweet and bitter are well balanced. Medium bodied. Almost redish quite big beer. Clean aroma of a hint of caramel and a hint of citrus. All restrained and nice

Bottle, with a cool brown paper bag. Bronze copper pour, white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, pine and citrus. Taste is malty and creamy, with pine, caramelised malt, spices and a bitter finish. Nice beer, especially for a lager.
Smells like a malty ipa. Cloudy brown with frothy head. Slightly cleaner then a malty ipa, slight chocolates. Good India brown lager.

Botella 37.5 cl tomada en el momento el 11-04-2015 en belmonte. (R101) De señor don lúpulo. Sabores y aromas intensos de maltas y lúpulos maduros con toques ligeros afrutados y cereales. Cuerpo medio a intenso con 8.5 vol bastante apreciables, amargo seco final bastante bueno y duradero. No esta mal.

Found some notes lying around back.
APPEARANCE: clear darker blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, some alcohol, fruity.
TASTE: dry, bitter, malty, oké, but expected more!

Deep amber to red colored, moderate to weak off white head, not very lasting. Aroma is quite sweet caramel, malt, pine and tropical fruits. Taste is very sweet caramel, candy fruity, tropical fruits, some floral, pine. Medium to strong bitterness, lasting aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation, sticky, oily. Overall too heavy and too sweet. 
(0,75 from Svijet Piva, Zagreb)

Dunkel hopfiger, mittelstark malziger Antrunk. Die Hopfigkeit bleibt auf angenehmem Level, vollmundig, rund. Der Hopfen überwiegt auch im Nachgeschmack, grasig, angenehme Süße. Gelungen. 11/11/11/12/8/11

bottle sample, poured a fuzzy hazy golden colour with a white head. lots of bursting fruits hit the nose, pineapple, peach, apricots, mango, juice forward, some caramel malt sweetness, slight notice of pine hops, soap, spiced yeast notes, pepper, creamy full bodied mouthfeel. very impressive beer. these guys know their stuff for sure
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours very hazy dark orange with a yellowish head. Aroma of cooked stone fruits with Mosaic aspects. And very earthy. Somewhat floral. Good stuff. Lots of flavor and flavors.

Bottle from Belmont Station. Pours cloudy dark golden with an attractive beige head and a musty floral aroma. There is a an earthy fruit and mixed malt flavor with a more bitter mosaic finish. A really tasty lager.

Bottle, 8.5%. Hazy dark amber/brown with big tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit, caramel, hop, notes of grapefruit and earthy. Flavour is malt, fruit, caramel, grainy, medium sweet, bitter, notes of grapefruit, little toasted, little earthy, little peach and pine.

Bottled 375ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Shiny amber coloured, medium sized off-white head, hops and caramel in the nose with a whiff of dog food. Toasted malt, caramel, notes of dried fruits and light alcohol with spicy hoppy notes in the finish. Too sweet overall.
Bottle. Clean lager profile giving way to a hoppy combination of citrus and herbs and even subtle vanilla and wood. Sort of like alpine herbal candy. Amazing - an excellent strong lager.

Geruch aromatisch, süß, Grapefruit und Mandarine. Startet süßlich, malzig. Danach aromatisch, malzig, Zitrus. Röstiger Abgang, malzig, Kaffee, Zitrusnoten, bitter.
Sehr gut.

Bottle. Light hazy amber body with medium frosty head. So, the aroma opens pretty caramel upfront, the one you know it will probably have a lot of resident extract it. But you get more fruity tropical notes later on. Tropical fruits. Taste has high caramel sweetness with earthy bitterness. Overwhelemed with the caramel side. Lagers arent dead, but this is no good lager. Body is full, medium carbonation.

Benvitt stort huve! Tropisk, citrus angenäm humle doft. Lätt kropp & krispig som en lager med stark IPA beska. Kåda, karamell, barrskog & tropik.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: malty and citrus, woody notes.
Appearance: hazy coper color, white head.
Taste: medium bitterness (herbs and flowers), malty (dark malts), clear lager profile, semi-dry.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, bitter herbal finish.
Overall: One of the best strong lagers Ive ever tried, recommended.
PS. Tasting panel after the collaboration brewing of Pinta and To Ol. Greetings Tobias.

Extraordinary beer, reddish in colour and with a fruity -orange, apricot, pineapple, peach- and caramel mouthfeel. The overall is robust, extremely tasty, with a moderate bitter and longlasting finish. Excellent.
37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy reddish amber with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are grapefruit, caramel, and pine - with a slightly bitter finish.
Bottle at Pibar, LausanneCloudy amber color with compact head. The aroma is very earthy. Earthy flavor too, strong bitterness, with some spicy yeast and bitter orange peel.Good. But dirty and rough.

Bottle. Almost clear amber liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, floral hops, mango, grain, sweet malt and fresh hops. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of citrus, toffee and mango. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Decent aroma but taste is a bit too sweet taste.
Pours a clearish light cobber with a small off-white head. Dry with a hoppy sweetness. Hoppy Soft carbonation. Long, very bitter finish. Good.

Bottle. Hazy golden brown with a large off white foam. Aromas are bready toasted malts with floral pine and tropical fruit. Creamy woodiness with peppery alcohol. Flavours are sweet tropical fruit with bittersweet pine and a grassy bitter pine finish. Very good.

Barwa i piana: barwa ciemno pomarańczowa / miedziana, zgaszona. Piana lekko zabarwiona (żółto -biała), drobno pęcherzykowa, obfita, umiarkowanie trwała, ale ładnie oblepiająca szkło. 

Aromat: cudowny i orzeźwiający aromat amerykańskich chmieli (ananas, mango, cytrusy, kwiaty). Jest tak silny, że trudno przy nim wyłowić słód (może lekkie melanoidyny), natomiast wyczuwalny powoli staje się alkohol. Profil jest czysty bez obecności estrów. 

Smak: wyraźna słodowa słodycz, szybko skontrowana chmielem. Na finiszu spieczona skórka od chleba oraz wyraźny alkohol. Balans w kierunku chmielu, ale sprawdza to się doskonale. 

Goryczka i odczucie w ustach: dosyć wysoka, owocowa goryczka, lekko drażniąca i długa, ale nie zalegająca. Krągła pełnia, dodatkowo wzmacniana przez względnie wysokie nasycenie. Wytrawna oraz alkoholowa, rozgrzewająca przełyk końcówka. 

Następne piwo, które zakupiłem dość przypadkowo, chcąc osiągnąć wartość zamówienia potrzebną na darmową wysyłkę. Jest to imperialny lager o czystym profilu, solidne chmielony trzema amerykańskimi odmianami. Zaskakują w nim przede wszystkim opakowanie (zapożyczona z piw belgijskich forma butelki owiniętej w papier) oraz dość głęboka barwa. W obu przypadkach są to jednak decyzje trafione. O ile podobne piwo z Mikkellera wypiłem z trudem, to tutaj musiałem się powstrzymywać żeby nie wychylić go w kilku większych haustach. Zaczynam się zatem zastanawiać czy solidnie chmielony lager nie jest lepszą alternatywą od IPA? Ogólnie świetne piwo, zdecydowanie do polecenia, choć cena niestety nie mała.

Who would have thought that a lager can be so hoppy? From a 375ml heavy-glassed green bottle, it pours much darker than your average lager with a hazy light amber body and a large foamy stable just off-white head. Hoppy tropical fruity and orangey aromas dominate on top of a caramel malty base and hints of pepper. Palate is medium bodied and provides medium sweet flavours before a long fruity bitter hop finish. Nicely balanced and very drinkable given the ABV.

BBF 14/08/2016, but already tastes "aged". 
Aroma: tropical hoppiness slightly over its prime. Alcohol at first, but quickly mellows out. 
Taste: very sweet malty base, some fruit and a very bitter finish. 
Ok, but probably would have been better fresher.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark copper pour with a big frothy magnolia head, citrus and light caramel aroma, taste has caramel and malt in the forefront backed up with light citrus hoppiness, grapefruit, very sweet and sticky ABV in your face.
375ml bottle. Pours dark caramel with a medium head. Aroma is burnt caramel, toast and mango hops. Taste has caramel to start and mango hops on the finish. Easy drinking.

Ámbar oscuro y limpio con espuma canela compacta y duradera. Aroma equilibrado con multas caramelo y lúpulo afrutado, melocotón y naranja con toques de pino. Cuerpo medio con inicio dulce de intensidad media y acaramelado con sabor de melocotón y final de amargor intenso y resinoso.
Cloudy amber with a big white head. Hoppy aroma of grapefruit and pine. Sweet malty flavour with caramel and lots and lots of hops. A bit too sweet for me, but great hop character.
Bottle @ Dolles home alone tasting. Hazy amber body with a large white head. Fruit, hops, caramel, sweetness, citrus fruit. A bit to sweet.
Bottle @ Dolleshomealonetasting, Odense, Feb 15. Pours hazy dark orange with a creamy white head. Grapefruit, pineapple, grass and mild caramel. Smooth and full bodied. Tasty stuff!
Rien à voir avec un lager maiscest très bon! Sa ressemble à un double IPA avec un coté pin et résineux!

375cl bottle. Pours hazy amber with a beautiful creamy off white head. Very good aroma of sweet malts, caramel and a ton of fruity hops. Taste is similar with a solid malty backbone and vegetal hoppy flavors. Long bitter finish, medium body, medium carbonation. Perfect sweet/bitter (or malts/hops) balancing. Excellent.

12.7 oz. bottle picked up at Party Source from notes. Pours an orange amber color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have a decent amount of fruit, citrus some tropicals over top of a pilsner malt base, bready notes, some grass and floral character show through as well. This was decent, but not a style that I particularly enjoy.

Bottled. Pours hazy, deep golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fryits and flowerish notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. A very nice and hoppy Lager.

Bouteille 37.5cl. 
Cuivrée-ambrée, col épais et crémeux blanc-cassé.
Arôme est agréablement houblonné avec de belles effluves tirant vers le résineux, pin et une agréable fruité tropical rappelant à la fois la mangue et un résiduel pamplemousse.
Palais est tout en ligne avec larôme. Notes houblonnées tirant vers le pin, fruité tropical en abondance (quoique en balance avec le malt) et un léger fini résineux. Malt pâle, caramel.
Leicht trübes bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit einer schönen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, frisch, grasig, harzig. Geschmack kräftig malzig, leicht süß, sehr fruchtig hopfig, harzig, lecker!

21st December 2014Hazy amber beer, decent pale cream colour head. Palate is light and a little softish with good fine carbonation. Airy malts bring light sweetness. Good malt cream then develops. Piney orangey hops kick in, slightly spicy and medium bitter. Touch of mango led tropical fruits underneath. Light semi dry finish with a mild bitter linger. Nicely done, pretty drinkable.

Pours copper with a small head.
Nose shows heavy sweet caramel malt, toffee and a little pine.
Malty flavours too before transitioning to an aggressive bitterness. Heaps of caramel and toffee.

Sample at the Badge-Whore Bowl (OSU vs AL) tasting on 01/01/2015. Dark hazy amber color with a medium bone white head that diminishes steadily. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, grassy hops and malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of floral hops, citrus and biscuit malt. The finish is crisp and moderately bitter with a grassy hops aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Bottle. Unclear darker golden in color with a whitish head. Tropical fruityness, some fresh grassy notes and sweetness in aroma. Creamy apricots too. Nice. Hoppy leafs, tropical fruits and grassy notes in taste. Citrus and some bitters in the end together with some malty notes. A good one.

375ml bottle. Clear copper colour with huge, thick, creamy, lasting and lacing, off-white to beige paragon of a head. Dry, grassy and citrusy hoppy aroma, lemon notes, some lemongrass, a touch of lime, backgroundish, typically tropical Mosaic notes, minimally resinous and cheesy-sweaty. Taste is slightly sweet malty, minimally dry hoppy, citrusy, hints of lemon, lemon tea, rather cautious tropical and resinous hoppy hints - obviously Mosaic-driven. Clean and super-soft, slightly sticky palate.

Bottle at home from the vineyardhazy dark Aberdeen with pillowy beige head collapsing to lacing. Pithy, sticky, blueberry, slightly sweaty, boozy. Full bodied, boozy, super pithy bitterness, long finish, pretty boozy citrus. Full on.
This is a an Imperial pils!!! Malty, bodied and hoppy. Fresh it must be heaven!

375 ml. bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck. Cool packaging, high price tag for the style etc. BBF 14/08/2016 (seriously, I keep seeing these ridiculously long BBF dates for hoppy beers). Dark copper amber, thick off-white creamy head. Huge lacing. Nose is huge tropical grapefruit, passion fruit, mango hops, very light resin & malts, very fruity. Taste is thick grapefruit, mango, light mango peel, passion fruit, malt, peach, light bread, light blue cheese hops, black pepper. Thick malty body & yet easy to drink. I like these (D)IPLs so much more than (D)IPAs. This is just perfect, exactly what you could ever hope from a beer like this. This is on par with Hopslam. De Proefbrouwerij just keeps impressing me.

Butelka 375ml.
OCZY : piwo jest przejrzyste o kolorze bursztynowym z odcieniami brązu. Piana jest jak bita śmietana, szara i trwała. 

NOS : piwo ma mocny aromat chmieli o nutach cytrusów, ziół, owoców tropikalnych i żywicy. Mocny jest również aromat spodu od ciasta, zbrązowiałego tosta i karmelu. Do tego alkohol pachnie jak bourbon i rozpuszczalnik. Wyczuwam również wanilie i delikatnie goździki. 

USTA : piwo ma umiarkowane nasycenie, jest tłuste o konsystencji mleka. 
Piwo jest całkiem słodkie o wyraźnych nutach słodowych podobnych do wyżej wymienionych aromatów tosta i spodu ciasta. Alkohol rozgrzewa a całość mocno atakuje kubki smakowe. Chmielenie jest mocne, gdzie żywiczność podkreśla alkohol i gorzkość. Gorzkość przypomina grejpfruta i przypalony tost. 

ODCZUCIA : jest to świetne piwo. Całkiem pijalne jak na tyle procent alkoholu. Przyjemne i gładkie do tego świetnie zbalansowane. Warte spróbowania. 

OCENA : 
smak : 8/10
pijalność : 7/10
styl : +1

Sampler at Whats Brewing 2014, Stavanger. Clear, glowing red mahogany colored body with an off-white film. Tropical fruits and gooseberries on the nose. Pungent and malty hop juice on the tongue. Full bodied and well carbonated.
On tap at Biercab. Amber colour with white head. Hoppy, pine and citric aroma. Hoppy, resinous, fruity, caramel, malt taste, slightly sweet. Medium body.

375 ml bottle at home. Almost clear, dark amber - copper color with a very nice big creamy off-white head. Aroma is hoppy and malty. Caramel and bready malty, also a malty-yeasty aroma that reminds me Greek traditional pies!! Fruity, grassy and piney hoppy. Taste is sweet and bitter. Hoppy fruity sweet and piney hoppy bitter. Body is almost medium, oily with soft carbonation. Strong bitter hoppy aftertaste.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bar, Copenhagen - amber pour with white head. Sweet fruity and malty aroma and taste, had some hoppy spice bite on the palate, very different "Pils" this but went down well. Pretty decent overall.

Keg at IMBC 14. Hazy amber shade with receding head. Aroma is mostly caramel, berries and cardboard. Super hoppy, super bitter taste. Not denying that its nice on the tongue but when things get this hoppy I find it a bit fatiguing. Id prefer the hops to enhance rather than overwhelm.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Clear, dark brown colour with a thin, lightly tanned head. Fruity aroma with toasted malts, rye bread, sweet fruits. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy textire and an average carbonation. Finishes dry and roasted with rye bread. Odd pils.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours clear amber with a thick off white head. Aroma is grapefruit, mango & pineapple. Taste is tropical, mango, pineapple with a bitter but very clean finish. Where was this lagered beer back in the Heineken-St. Pauli Girl days?

Bottle at Brewdog Stockholm, april 18th 2014. Dark orange body with a rather big white head. Strong hoppy aroma of peach, apricot and pine, also soma caramel, light grassy notes. Taste follows the same hoppy scheme, with a stronger malt character in form of bread and caramel, dark fruity finish, pleasant lasting bitterness. Good complexity throughout, and a real pleasure to drink.

Bottle in brown paper bag. Pours reddish orange bone white head. Nose and taste is dank grapefruit peel, peppercorn, toasty bread, orange peel, freshly juiced grapefruits and spicy yeast. Medium body.

bottle, 38th bday drinks, thanks to mads for the trade. the brown paper bag reminded me of drinking beer on australian trains and the theory that so many australians drink beer out of paper bags because the police cant search the contents of your bag or something like that. anyways, this is much better than anything found inside a paper bag in australia - clear amber; aroma of melon, brown sugar and slivovice; just the right amount of bitterness, some ipaish tropical character but also grassy. wish a czech brewer could make an extremely drinkable imperial pils like this

Pours a deep orange with a foamy looking lightly tanned head. Clean aroma with malts and some grassy hops. Taste is malty, subdued alcohol notes and a crisp bitterness. Very nice and highly drinkable. Close to full bodied with high levels of co2.

Big beige head. Clear deep dark brownish red body with
carbonation and little particles. Deep resiny tropical fruit
aroma with wooden pineapple notes. Dry-sweet earthy perfumy
raisiny malt taste with plastic and spicy rye notes. Fullish
body. Mild mouthfeel. Dryish spicy wooden vanilla aftertaste
with smoky resiny citrus notes. Interesting and different. Full
of flavour, yet clean and harmonic. A little bit too perfumy for
a full score. (0.375l bottle from ... not sure.)

Birthday present from my girlfriend, but I know it came from New Beer Distributors in Manhattan: Pours copper with a nice frothy white head. Aroma is plenty of citrus hops, a bit of earth, some sweet malts, resin (no shortage of that). Taste is bitter, but not excessively so. Body is nice; slightly oily, but still very drinkable. One would be hard-pressed to determine that this is a lager. The brown bag around it is a great way to keep out the light in a green bottle. Heineken, take notice.
Mycket malt och väldigt välhumlad i aromen. Väldigt krämig i kroppen. Väldigt ra fyllighet.

Bottle, 375ml paper wrapped. It pours a hazy, orange-ish golden body under a finger-thick, dense, off-white to light beige head. Its very hoppy on the nose, almost like sniffing hop pellets. Pine cones, oranges, lime zest... and some maltyness. The flavor has malty sweetness in the back, with lots of citrusy, piney hops up front. Grapefruit, resins and some lime. Almost too bitter, its at least very intense. Its full-bodied and slighlty warming on the palate, sweetish, yet dry, and with a suitable carbonation level. Lasting bitter and citrusy finish. Would have guessed DIPA if someone asked me what this is. Nice anyway. 140619

Bottle 375ml @ Cabin, Tråsåvika Camping
Pours hazy amber with a off-white/beige head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, peach, caramel and alcohol. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium to heavy bitter with a long slightly warm, citrus fruity and slightly caramel finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Color ambrato lievemente nebuloso con soffice e massiccio cappello di schiuma bianca. Intenso aroma luppolato e fruttato con sentori di mango, scorza di arancia e biscotto. Gusto rotondo e amaro con forti note lyppolate, fruttate e agrumate; finale lungo, amaro e persistente. Corpo medio, effervescenza piacevole, struttura setosa: ottima!

Bottle 37.5 cl.
Amber with large creamy off-white head. Heavy malts, caramel, citrus and some hops on the nose. Flavour is sweet malt, with long bitter finish.

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a fantastic dark orange with solid white head. Nose shows heaps of tropical and sweet fruits. Drinks so damn easily. Heavy pine, grass, tropical fruits and slight caramel on the taste. Can't tell it's 8.5% at all! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Poured a hazy copper color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate complex hop aroma. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Well worth having.

Bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy deep amber colour with a compact, beige, creamy head. An imidiate hoppy aroma with lots of apricot, grapefruit, basement, pine and grass. Theres also some sweetnes with caramel, tropical fruits and berries. The flavour is also filled with grassy hops, grapefruit and pine. Has a soft and rich mouth feel, and a medium to heavy bitterness. A definitely aromatic and tasteful beer where the hops being dominant all through. It still feels balanced with sweet malt in the background.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends.
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Hoppy and fruity on the nose, some cardboard also. Mandarin and resinous hops on the flavor, caramel malts and some toffee also. Not too good.
4414

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Rated on 03.05.2014
Aroma has caramel and some fruity tones. Flavour has caramel, berryish malt and also sweet malty tones. Very sticky stuff, can feel it in my hands too.

Bottle from Mane Liquor shared at Eagle Bay Brewery. pours vibrant orange with some haze and a big fluffy white cap. Nose is very tropical and punchy with some bright citrus and caramel. Loaded with hops and it works nicely. Drinks far too easily for 8.5%! Heaps of passionfruit and mango in this with some nice grassiness and tang on the finish. I like it

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends

Pours dark orange with a small head. Aroma of fruits, orange, citrus and grapefruit with some grass. Taste is smooth, sweet and citrusy with some grapefruit, orange, malts and grass. Finish is malty, bready and fruity. Quite fruity imperial pils.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a dark golden colour with a small head. Aroma of grassy hops, some earth and caramel. Flavour of caramel, grassy bitterness, some earthiness, alcohol and floral hops. Some residual sugar. Medium bodied and a sweet, bitter, grainy finish. Too sweet.

12.7oz bottle, from Dutchs. Date on the cap reads 12/12/15. Came in a pretty neat printed-on brown paper bag. Hazy darker red orange color, with fine particles visible suspended in the body. Good thin khaki head, leaves great thicker sheets of lace. Medium to bigger body. Super-smooth, lighter carbonation. Great, juicy, fruity hop aroma. Lightly spicy. Some good bready biscuity lightly caramel malt. Moderate to bigger bitter taste, light to moderate sweet. Just a very lightly spicy hop bite in the end. Very smooth, tasty, easy-drinking stuff. Great, big complex malt and hop profile.
On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Coppered colored, good foam. Immediately hoppy aromas; high intensity- also good fruitiness. Medium body & complexity. Solid bittterness-ok balance. Very enjoyable
Bottle at Örebro Ölcafé. Fruity and malty smell. Sweet and malty taste, hoppy with grass, grapefruit and pine. Full bodied. Very nice!

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Pours a hazy dark orange-hued amber body with a large foamy off-white head. Nose is dark fruits, flowers, peach, pine and hints of caramel and something I can only describe as "meaty"..umami, perhaps? Taste is mellow American hop tones: red fruits, peaches, mild grapefruit, pine and hints of caramel malts, straw and raisins far in the back. Full, yet somehow crisper (the lager factor?) body, medium to high carbonation. Not bad; pretty peculiar and rather drinkable. However, it does end up tasting like some sort of twist on a double IPA.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Hazy dark orange with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 120414

This beer is very, very special. The aroma is magnificent. Tons of pine and citrus. It reminds me of the onslaught of hop on the nose that I have only tasted in GKnight from Oskar Blues. The hops taste fresh and grassy with a beautiful finish of orange rind. Two thumbs up and a snap from me!

Draught @ Luppolo 12, Rome. Pours amber with a offwhite head. Aorma of malt, caramel, sweet fruit, peach, apircot, pine. Flavor is malty, caramel, sugar, fruity hops, peach, apricot, citrus, pine. Medium body, soft carbonation, little hot alcohol. 060414

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours clear deep amber/gold with a big frothy off-white head. Strong inviting aroma,sweet malts, lots of fresh orange and new cut grass. Taste is smooth silky, light sweet apricot and oranges, herbal malts, some good bitter resiny and fruity hops in the more than dry finish,very weak alcohol presence at the finish

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Ruby red, big tanned head. Smells of mint, wood and resins, some zesty and fruity notes, dark fruits and dark malts as well. Heavy sweet, malt fruityness, dark fruits, zest and plums. Medium bitter, resins and zests. Deep complexity, both in the malt and hop composition. Smooth balanced, just lovely. Best Strong Lager/Imperial Pils ever!

Flaske, 375 ml. Uklar ravgylden med et frodigt off-white skum. Heftig perfumeret duft. En buket af virile og frodige humlenoter. Blomster. Kandiseret citrus. Overmoden passionsfrugt. Karamel. Ris a la mande. Benzin. Sødlig malt likør. Tør, bitter humlet finish. God.

Bottle, bought @ Mikkeller and Friends Bottle Shop. Pours deep, clear amber with a large, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma has apricot, oranges, caramel, fresh crisp malts. Medium carbonation, fat and oily mouthfeel. Flavour has good crisp malts, caramel, fat and oily hop oils, oranges, apricot. Light warming, fine bitterness. A touch of yeast that detracts this from going very well.
Draught. Low fluffy white lasting head. Hazy amber body. Fruity roasted malt grassw hops aroma. Mild creamy fruity hoppy flavor. Low carbonation. Long finish. Alcohol well hidden.

Appearance: Hazy amber color with a off white head. Nice lacing.Aroma: Rich smoth grapefruit hoppy, fruity and malty.Palate: Medium + body. Tad sweet and a fresh bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Balanced fruity, malty and lovely fresh hoppy.Overall impression: I do not care what kind of style they claim this is. Lovley beer! Spot on.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway

Bottle from Vinmonopolet.
Hazy brown, candyfloss head. Full malty body, lovely fresh grassy hops. Fine balance, no need to put this in a brown paper bag!

05.03.2014, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, dried fruits, hops, leafs, sap, caramel malts, grass, sugar. Taste is slightly harsh grassy, hops, leafs, sap, lawn, caramel malts, bark. Medium to longlasting bitterness. Nice.

bought at vinmonopolet vika. Pours amber with a firm tan head. Aroma is intensely hoped, with pine and grass. Some earthy notes. Taste is again hoppy. Pine dominates. Body is medium. Easy to drink inspite of the hops. I really enjoyed this one.

Bottle 375ml. [ As To Øl Brown Paper Bag ].Clear medium amber orange color with a large, creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, sweet malt, caramel, sweet caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, orange - citrus, light grass. Initial flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter, finish flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and heavy bitter, with a long duration, dry, bitter, hoppy, orange, grass, sweet apricot. Body is medium to full, texture is oily and sticky, carbonation is soft. [20140212]
375 ml bottle. Clear amber with off white head. Aroma malty, perfume, caramel. Taste is medium sweet, very bitter, fruit, malt, perfume and caramel. Nice!
Bottle. Pours a clear golden pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity peachy hoppy weak piney aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy piney flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy finish.

How: Bottle.
Where: NK Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Amber colour with a large off-white head.
Aroma: Hops, citrus, caramel, some fruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Mild hops, fruit, almond, orange zest, citrus. Something tastes odd in the finish. Leaves a bad taste in the mouth.

Rødgylden skum råhvid lang tæt 
Appelsin citrus malt røsukke 
Bitter meget sød moderat
Fyldig blød 
@f1

Bottle. Clear copper with a large frothy off white head. Fresh hoppy aroma with peach, sweet oranges, light pine, forest, white bread, light alcohol sharpness, warming finish. Medium/full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Medium sweet and bitter with a long light dry finish.

Bottle at 0Connors Uppsala, February 2014. 

Clear brownish/amber with a large head. Fresh and nicely drinkable with hops, citrus, grass and some caramel. Nicely balanced with a bitter finish.

Bottled. A red beer with a huge orangey head. The aroma has notes of spicy hops, malt, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, alcohol, spices, alfa acids, and hops, leading to a quite bitter and hoppy finish.

Bottle.
Hazy orange-brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of hops and citrus with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, pine needles and citrus with notes of grapefruits and alcohol.
Hoppy and warming alcoholic finish.

Pours clear reddish amber with low off-white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma of fruit (peach, mango, apricot), caramel, light toffee, light bread. Taste is light sourish sweet, tart and caramel, balanced with hoppy resin finish. Body is medium and creamy with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @Brewdog Bar Stockholm. Pours amber with a reddish twist and a quite large frothy head. Aroma is rye bread, caramel, orange rinds, hay, wet soil. Taste is rye bread, honey, orange rinds, peach. Very understated, does not make a fuss. Very well balanced though!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home, shared with Theis. Pours a clearish light cobber with a small off-white head. Dry with a hoppy sweetness. Hoppy aromas of Nelson? with hints of Sorachi? Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Long, very bitter finish. Good.
Draught at Sunes Place. Clear brown - offwhite head. Nice hoppy. Fresh hoppy - oiley hoppy. Roasted. Nutty. Ok bitterness. Light tobacco. Nice malty. Lovely balance.

37.5 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden amber with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and light pine. Fruity, peachy, citrusy and dry grapefruity to pine hoppy. Lingering fruity and crisp hoppy finish.
